english_translation: Narrated by Umm Hani: She complained to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about weakness. He said to her: 'Glorify Allah one hundred times, for it is better than freeing one hundred slaves. Praise Allah one hundred times, for it is better than giving one hundred horses for the sake of Allah. Magnify Allah one hundred times, for it is better than giving one hundred sacrificial camels to the House of Allah. And say: There is no god except Allah, alone without partner, to Him belongs the sovereignty and to Him is the praise and He is able to do all things, one hundred times, for it is better than what is between the heavens and the earth. And no deed shall be raised for anyone more excellent than this, except for one who says like what you said or adds more.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Uthman al-Nahdi: Salman used to teach us glorification of Allah, saying: 'Glorify Allah: Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest, repeatedly. O Allah, You are Most High and Most Great, beyond having a wife, beyond having a child, beyond having a partner in sovereignty, beyond having a helper from weakness, and glorify Him glorification. Allah is the Greatest glorification. O Allah, forgive us, O Allah, have mercy upon us.' Then he said: 'By Allah, these will be written, and these will not be abandoned, and this will be intercession for these.'
